result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

2:21 PM Defendant Cristina Trevizo in court.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Cristina Trevizo.  ADA Brown appears in court for State of Wisconsin. State relays that discovery and offer have been provided to defense. Additional JPTC requested.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for November 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on November 15, 2022 at 11:30 am.

2:13 PM  Defendant Cristina Trevizo in court.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Cristina Trevizo.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty pleas entered by court.  Bond continued.
Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on August 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant appears in court with Attorney Jolin. ADA Brown appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received complaint. Attorney Jolin waives time limits for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver and sets preliminary hearing for May 25th at 2:00 pm. bond continued.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. ADA appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court makes finding of probable cause for purposes of todays hearing. Court sets $2,500.00 signature bond. Conditions, Maintain absolute sobriety, No Contact with Codi Mayo.
